snippet: American officials have made it clear they do not want the airstrikes to get ahead of the ground action against ISIS, which they said would take time to mass.
abstract: Obama administration says several Arab nations have offered to join in airstrikes against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; officials say any sustained military campaign does not appear imminent and is likely to require even more significant commitment from other nations and fighting forces in region.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from Paris.

lead_paragraph: American officials have made it clear they do not want the airstrikes to get ahead of the ground action against ISIS, which they said would take time to mass.

headline.main: Arab Nations Offer to Fight ISIS From Air
headline.print_headline: Arab Nations Offer to Fight ISIS From Air
